On Wed, Jan 04, 2012 at 11:04:13AM +0100, Daniel Dehennin wrote:
> When using git-pbuilder with cowbuilder, it could be interesting to use > the last debian/changelog entry to set the DIST environment variable.
> The order of choices is the following:
> I'll try to look at providing a patch.
I'd rather have this based on the branch's name not the changelog (and rather set the changelog based on the branch too).
> I'd rather have this based on the branch's name not the changelog (and > rather set the changelog based on the branch too).
I'm not sure, I use temporary branch names to test the building of my packages, I think the debian/changelog entry distribution field is more "authoritative" than the branch name.
I use --debian-branch to test the build, but to choose the cowbdbuilder chroot, I thought debian/changelog more "accurate".
On Wed, Jan 04, 2012 at 03:16:08PM +0100, Daniel Dehennin wrote:
> > I'd rather have this based on the branch's name not the changelog (and > > rather set the changelog based on the branch too).
> I'm not sure, I use temporary branch names to test the building of my > packages, I think the debian/changelog entry distribution field is more > "authoritative" than the branch name.
> I use --debian-branch to test the build, but to choose the cowbdbuilder > chroot, I thought debian/changelog more "accurate".
We generate the changelog from the information on the branch you're on anyway so this should be the source of information assuming you're maintaining at least on branch per debian release.
topic branches are fine since we need to pick the distribution from a pattern anyway not a specific branch name.
> We generate the changelog from the information on the branch you're on > anyway so this should be the source of information assuming you're > maintaining at least on branch per debian release.
topic branches are > fine since we need to pick the distribution from a pattern anyway not a > specific branch name.
I think I miss understand something, I apologize if I'm turning in round, the "branch name" is not directly related to the distribution name, isn't it?
The debian/changelog distribution field is UNRELEASED or unstable and the user can change it by editing the file[1].
The branch name can be whatever use want, like ebo for etch-backports for example.
I think having on base-DIST-ARCH per distribution I maintain is more useful than per branch name.
I can have many branches for on distribution (aka topic branches), their debian/changelog seems more relevant to me than the branch name.

One of the problems with this idea that I'm not sure has come up in this discussion is that the build chroots for DIST are generally named for the code name (lenny, squeeze, etc.) so they don't change over time, but debian/changelog will have things like "unstable", "stable-security", "stable-proposed-updates", and so forth.
So you need a mapping, and that mapping will change with each Debian release, which means the user really needs to supply it.
Once the user is supplying a mapping, it's probably just as easy to map the branch names as to map the debian/changelog values.
